snippet: Officers walking a beat in the city’s housing projects are watching not only for offenses but also for behavior that is not illegal at all. Citations can lead to evictions.
abstract: New York City police officers routinely look not only for criminal behavior but also behavior that violates New York City Housing Authority rules when they patrol housing projects; little scrutiny has been paid to tactic amid broader calls to ratchet down pressure on low-level crimes.

byline.contributor: Benjamin Mueller and Mireya Navarro contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officers walking a beat in the city’s housing projects are watching not only for offenses but also for behavior that is not illegal at all. Citations can lead to evictions.

headline.main: Police Patrols in New York Public Housing Draw Scrutiny
headline.print_headline: Police Patrols in the Projects Draw Scrutiny
